title: 961-A
statement: A. Tetristime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given a following process.There is a platform with $$$n$$$ columns. $$$1 \\times 1$$$ squares are appearing one after another in some columns on this platform. If there are no squares in the column, a square will occupy the bottom row. Otherwise a square will appear at the top of the highest square of this column.When all of the $$$n$$$ columns have at least one square in them, the bottom row is being removed. You will receive $$$1$$$ point for this, and all the squares left will fall down one row.You task is to calculate the amount of points you will receive.InputThe first line of input contain 2 integer numbers $$$n$$$ and $$$m$$$ ($$$1 \\le n, m \\le 1000$$$) — the length of the platform and the number of the squares.The next line contain $$$m$$$ integer numbers $$$c_1, c_2, \\dots, c_m$$$ ($$$1 \\le c_i \\le n$$$) — column in which $$$i$$$-th square will appear.OutputPrint one integer — the amount of points you will receive.ExampleInput3 91 1 2 2 2 3 1 2 3Output2NoteIn the sample case the answer will be equal to $$$2$$$ because after the appearing of $$$6$$$-th square will be removed one row (counts of the squares on the platform will look like $$$[2~ 3~ 1]$$$, and after removing one row will be $$$[1~ 2~ 0]$$$).After the appearing of $$$9$$$-th square counts will be $$$[2~ 3~ 1]$$$, and after removing one row it will look like $$$[1~ 2~ 0]$$$.So the answer will be equal to $$$2$$$.

processed.result:
You have a platform with $n$ columns.  Squares of size $1 \times 1$ appear one at a time in some of these columns. If a column is empty, the square will go in the bottom row. If a column already has squares, the new square will go on top of the highest existing square in that column.

When all $n$ columns have at least one square, the bottom row is removed, and you get 1 point. All the remaining squares fall down one row.

Your task is to figure out how many points you will get in total.

**Input:**

* The first line has two numbers: $n$ (the number of columns) and $m$ (the number of squares).
* The second line has $m$ numbers: $c_1, c_2, ..., c_m$ (the column number where each square will appear).

**Output:**

* Print one number: the total number of points you will get.

You have a platform with a certain number of columns. Squares are placed one by one in these columns.  A square goes to the bottom of a column if it's empty, otherwise it goes on top of the highest existing square in that column.  When all columns have at least one square, the bottom row is removed, earning you one point.  The remaining squares fall down one row.  Calculate the total number of points you will earn.
